title: Advanced Davinci Resolve Studio Editor (Real Estate + Motion Graphics Editor)
description:
We are a growing real estate media company specializing in cinematic, modern real estate listing videos and personal brand talking-head content. We work with top realtors, construction teams, and professional brands, and we are building systems that allow us to scale without sacrificing quality.

This editor role is critical to our growth. You will help maintain our visual standards, execute repeatable workflows, and ensure every project meets our quality expectations while delivering a 10/10 client experience.

Quality is non-negotiable. We do not cut corners and expect the same standard from everyone on our team.

We are looking for a DaVinci Resolve Studio Video Editor who has strong fundamentals and is actively leveling up into more advanced execution, especially with motion titles and modern social media styles.

Important:

To confirm attention to detail, please include the word “Resolve” in the first line of your application message. Applications without this will not be reviewed.



Responsibilities:

- Edit real estate listing videos with cinematic pacing, clean color, and polished audio.

- Edit talking-head videos with modern motion titles and simple animations inspired by trending social media styles.

- Execute consistent edits using provided LUTs, templates, and SOPs.

- Deliver projects on fast turnaround timelines (typically 24–48 hours).

- Maintain organization, consistency, and quality across repeat projects.



Job Requirements:

- Solid experience editing in DaVinci Resolve Studio. Studio version is required. 

- Comfortable creating clean motion titles and simple animations (lower thirds, callouts, emphasis text).

- Efficient color grading workflow and clean audio handling.

- Strong communication skills and proficiency in English.

- Willing to learn and work within our project management software, ClickUp.

- Ability to work within U.S. business hours (PST) or overlap when needed.

- High attention to detail and ability to take feedback well.



Culture Fit (Non-Negotiable):

- Punctual and reliable.

- Coachable and committed to continuous improvement.

- Positive, solutions-focused attitude.

- No ego — just excellence.



Compensation & Growth:

- Per gig position. Potential to grow into a part-time and/or full-time editor after working together for some time.

- Starts with a free test edit. If hired, you will be compensated for the edit. 

- Clear systems, SOPs, and feedback provided to help you improve.

- Opportunity for long-term work, increased responsibility, and higher compensation as quality and efficiency improve.



How to Apply:

Please send the following;

- A short introduction about yourself.

- Relevant work samples (real estate, talking-head, or social content preferred).

- Confirmation that you can meet 24–48 hour turnaround times and work within PST hours when required.

title: Active Campaign & Email Automation Specialist
description:
We are looking for a detail?oriented ActiveCampaign Specialist to set up, manage, and optimize our
 marketing automations, campaigns, and lists.  



 You will work closely with our marketing team to turn strategy into live automations that generate leads, nurture subscribers, and re?engage past customers. 



Responsibilities:



Build and manage
 campaigns in ActiveCampaign (broadcasts and automated sequences). 

Create and maintain automations (welcome flows, nurture sequences, re?engagement, reminders). 

Set up list segmentation, tags, and custom fields to keep data clean and organized. 

Connect forms, landing pages, and integrations (e.g., website, lead forms, or other tools) to ActiveCampaign. 

Monitor deliverability, open/click rates, and conversions, and suggest improvements. Run basic A/B tests (subject lines, send times, simple layout tests).

Document workflows and updates so the team can understand and reuse them. 



Qualifications:



1–2+ years of hands-on experience with ActiveCampaign or similar tools (Klaviyo, MailerLite, HubSpot, etc.). 

Solid understanding of
 marketing best practices (list hygiene, segmentation, consent, basic deliverability). 

Comfortable working with tags, segments, basic automation logic (if/else, goals, triggers).

 Good written English and attention to detail for naming conventions, testing, and QA. 

Reliable, responsive, and able to follow SOPs while also suggesting improvements. 



Work Setup:

Remote, full-time or part-time (to be discussed). Must be available for at least a few hours overlap with CST USA for check-ins. 

Long-term role for the right person.



How to Apply

Please send:A short introduction (2–3 lines) about your ActiveCampaign experience. 

2–3 screenshots or a short Loom explaining an automation or campaign you built.

title: Chief of Staff / Executive Assistance
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Chief of Staff to serve as a strategic partner to executive leadership. This role combines project management, operations, and organizational leadership to drive execution, improve efficiency, and support decision-making at the highest level. The ideal candidate thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where priorities shift frequently and is a self-starter, leader, and problem-solver who can operate under pressure with patience and resilience.



Key Responsibilities



Partner directly with executive leadership to manage priorities, initiatives, and organizational alignment.



Lead and oversee diverse projects that are constantly changing, ensuring deadlines, deliverables, and shifting priorities are met.



Build, maintain, and optimize systems in Notion to organize projects, track performance, and streamline workflows.



Coordinate cross-functional communication and collaboration using Slack, ensuring alignment and accountability across teams.



Prepare reports, strategic briefs, and executive presentations using Google Workspace or Microsoft Office Suite.



Anticipate leadership needs and proactively solve problems with a critical-thinking mindset.



Handle confidential information with the highest level of discretion and professionalism.



Drive operational excellence, process improvements, and strategic initiatives.



Remain calm and effective under high-stress conditions, with exceptional patience and interpersonal skills.



Required Skills & Qualifications



Master’s degree in Business Administration, Operations, Communications, or a related field.



Minimum of 4 years of professional experience in operations, project management, consulting, or executive support.



Strong proficiency with Notion, Google Workspace or Microsoft Suite, and Slack.



Fluent in English (spoken and written) with outstanding communication, writing, and presentation skills.



Highly organized with strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.



Technologically savvy and quick to adopt new tools and systems.



Independent, proactive, and able to lead initiatives with minimal oversight.



Curious, driven, and eager to learn — with a willingness to explore new ideas, discover solutions, and continuously grow.



Strong critical-thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a mindset for tackling challenges head-on.



Resilient and resourceful, capable of navigating fast-changing, high-pressure situations.



Preferred Qualifications



Experience working directly with C-level executives or founders.



Background in consulting, strategy, operations, or business administration.



Familiarity with remote-first or fast-growing startup environments.





Please send Resume and Short Intro Video

title: Database, Reporting and AI Specialist - Data Analyst & Automation Expert
description:
We’re a fast-growing travel organization seeking an AI Systems, Automation, and Data Specialist to help us harness the full potential of our data across multiple platforms. This role focuses on building intelligent systems that connect and automate data flows using tools like Zapier, Google Sheets, BigQuery, Looker Studio, AgencyAnalytics, and similar platforms. The ideal candidate will design and maintain clean, scalable data structures—integrating data from sales, marketing, and operations—to power insightful dashboards, discover patterns, and drive strategic decision?making.



Responsibilities include setting up automations between CRM, marketing, and analytics systems; managing spreadsheets and databases with precision; developing and maintaining a central data lake; and producing transparent, actionable reporting that reveals opportunities for growth. Candidates should demonstrate deep technical understanding, show real examples of completed work over video, and clearly explain their processes.



This can be a part?time or full?time role depending on availability and performance, with significant growth potential for someone passionate about AI?assisted business intelligence and automation in the travel sector.

How you d
 when to scale a campaign

title: Senior Direct Response Landing Page & Product Page Builder (High Conversion Ecom)

title: Trial Task for E-Commerce Video Editor Position
description:
**WATCH THIS VIDEO FIRST:

( www.loom.com/share/6c084f28688b430c8fa31a710363974b?sid=c3a7d628-a36a-4a6b-ae00-b30d911862b6 )



If you are going to complete the trial task, please message me here with the message “I’M IN!” to confirm your participation.



Example Of A How A Video Should Look Like: ( https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IGnBvS4kbdbjw1r1H0vT3WDP433wvMpn/view?usp=sharing )



Task Objective



The purpose of this trial task is to assess your skills in video editing by having you create a high-converting creative for our brand, (Meylora).



This task will allow us to evaluate:

- Your understanding of our brand.

- Your ability to identify our audience's pain points.

- Your proficiency in creating engaging and compelling ad creatives.



Task Instructions



The ad should be at least 35 seconds long.

Ensure the video flows naturally, with the right balance of emotional appeal and rational benefits.

Be sure to include a strong call-to-action, whether it’s a discount offer, a limited-time promotion, or a money-back guarantee.



---



Step 1. Sourcing Footage



1. Sourcing Footage:

You can use the Google Drive folder provided ( https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1xfT7s6RZ-MIXFY2BthvYZ2XzlLYMHY-2?usp=sharing ).

Ensure that the footage is relevant, high quality, and doesn’t contain any other branding or loud music.





Step 2: Create the Video Ad



1. Assembling the Video:

Using the footage you sourced, create a high-converting video ad that is at least 35 seconds long.

Ensure the the ad is cohesive and structured.



2. Engagement:

The video should be highly engaging and hold the audience’s attention from the hook to the call-to-action. Add subtitles in our brand colors(Purple).



3. Best Practices:

Use a proven video ad framework that has been successful in other high-performing ads (e.g., problem-solution format, before-and-after transformations) if you struggle coming up with a good structure.



---



Additional Resources:



Our Current Ads Library: https://www.facebook.com/ads/library/?active_status=active&ad_type=all&country=US&is_targeted_country=false&media_type=all&search_type=page&view_all_page_id=522504520939528



---



Submission Requirements



Please submit the following to our chat:

1. The final video ad file.

2. A brief explanation of the research you conducted and why you made the creative decisions.





Thank you for your interest, if you are selected you will be gifted $50 USD as a bonus, we look forward to reviewing your work!

title: Business Development Manager / Operations Architect (KPI & Team Building)
description:
Job Title: Business Development & Operations Architect (KPIs + Hiring + Systems)

The Mission:

We are a growing company with a clear vision, but we need a System Builder to create the internal engine. I am looking for a right-hand person who doesn’t just "manage" tasks but designs the organizational structure, sets the metrics for success, and hires the talent to execute it.



Your Core Responsibilities:



Organizational Design: Audit our current workflow and build a scalable team hierarchy.



KPI Management: Define, implement, and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for every department to ensure accountability.



Talent Acquisition: Identify gaps in our team, write job descriptions, and lead the recruitment process to hire A-players.



SOP Creation: Build a library of Standard Operating Procedures so the business can run without constant supervision.



Who You Are:



You have a proven track record of building company structures or scaling departments.



You are data-driven—you believe that if it’s not measured, it’s not managed.



You are an expert recruiter who can spot talent and culture-fit from a mile away.



You have high-level English skills and a "builder" mentality (you find solutions, not excuses).



?? PRE-INTERVIEW TEST (Follow these steps or your application will be ignored):

To ensure you have the attention to detail required for this role, please follow these instructions exactly:



Subject Line: Change your application subject to: "SYSTEM ARCHITECT - [Your Years of Management Experience]" (e.g., SYSTEM ARCHITECT - 5 Years).



The Question: In your cover letter, answer this: "If a department is underperforming, what are the first 3 metrics (KPIs) you would check to find the root cause?"



The Video: Record a 60-90 second Loom video introducing yourself and describing one specific team or system you built from scratch. (Paste the link in your application).



Tools: List the top 3 software tools you use to manage team performance and tasks.



Why Join Us?



Full-time, long-term remote position.



High level of autonomy—you design the systems.



Competitive salary based on experience and results.
